xxl.core.math.statistics.parametric.aggregates
Class StatelessVarianceEstimator

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.math.functions.AggregationFunction<P,A>
      xxl.core.math.functions.StatelessAggregationFunction<java.lang.Number,java.lang.Number[],java.lang.Number>
          xxl.core.math.statistics.parametric.aggregates.StatelessVarianceEstimator
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class StatelessVarianceEstimator
extends StatelessAggregationFunction<java.lang.Number,java.lang.Number[],java.lang.Number>

Provides the same functionality as StatefulVarianceEstimator but keeps the state information. Hence, the incrementally computed aggregate consists of an Object array whose first component is the current variance and the following components are the state.

See Also:
StatefulVarianceEstimator, Serialized Form

Method Detail

invoke

public java.lang.Number[] invoke(java.lang.Number[] state,
                                 java.lang.Number next)
Function call for incremental aggregation. The first argument corresponds to the old aggregate, whereas the second argument corresponds to the new incoming value.
Depending on these two arguments the new aggregate, i.e. average, has to be computed and returned.

Specified by:
invoke in class AggregationFunction<java.lang.Number,java.lang.Number[]>
Parameters:
state - result of the aggregation function in the previous computation step
next - next object used for computation
Returns:
an Object array that contains the new aggregation value of type Double, and a counter of type Integer that reveals how often this function has been invoked.
